meanings.definition: relating to or located in the front part of the body in animals
meanings.sent1: The prosomal fins help the fish steer in the water.
meanings.sent2: The prosomal eyes of the owl are keen at night.
meanings.sent3: The prosomal nose of the dog twitched as it sniffed the air.
meanings.sent4: Her prosomal instincts told her to be cautious in the unfamiliar forest.
meanings.sent5: The prosomal claws of the bear were sharp and powerful.

meanings.definition: of or relating to the prosoma in arachnids
meanings.sent1: The prosomal legs of the spider moved swiftly across the web.
meanings.sent2: The prosomal markings on the scorpion's back were striking.
meanings.sent3: The prosomal dance of the tarantula amused the onlookers.
meanings.sent4: Her prosomal agility in problem-solving impressed her colleagues.
meanings.sent5: The prosomal silk spun by the spider was strong and intricate.
